page.title: 17FARMING-A TYPICAL DAIRY FARM
page.content: The farm covers 16 acres. It has 49 freisan cows and a Hereford bull on loan. In summer the cows are put in the fields and in the winter they are inside on barley straw. The farmer buys 2,000 bales a year for bedding. The{milking parlour}deals with 6 cows at a time and the milk is kept in a {refrigerated tank.}It is collected each day by milk tanker and taken to the creamery at St.Erth. The cows give 800-1000 litres a day. This farm has been given a{special licence to sell {milk straight to the public.}The farm grows grass for silage which is kept in a clamp or baled for storage in plastic bags.It also grows kale and stubble turnips for feeding to the cows.Farm equipment used includes a tractor, harrow, fertilizer, spinner, roller, dung spreader, cattle crusher, mower and a spring cultivator.
